events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection, requesting a new claim to begin processing.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident as it involves a vehicle collision on a public road.
A claims agent specializing in automobile accidents was assigned to handle the case for prompt follow-up.
Acknowledged claim receipt to the customer, confirming that the insurance company has officially started processing.
Requested police report, vehicle photos, and driver’s license copies to verify details of the vehicle collision.
Customer submitted all required documents including police report and pictures of the damaged vehicle promptly.
Assigned investigator began examining the accident circumstances, reviewing provided documents and eyewitness accounts.
Investigation concluded confirming the liability and damage estimates as part of the auto accident claim process.
A settlement offer was prepared based on the investigation report and sent to the claimant for review.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement amount and expressed satisfaction with the communication.
Claim approval was granted officially after receiving customer acceptance of the settlement agreement.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and transferred to the customer’s account without delay.
The insurance claim for the auto accident was officially closed after confirming full resolution with the claimant.
All records and documentation related to the auto accident claim were securely archived in the company database.
